bug.author: saipj
bug.description:
Describe the bug A clear and concise description of what the bug is. Encountering error when running YOLO V3 perf test. Please find the error below. [E:onnxruntime:Default, runner.cc:185 RunTests] Test yolov3 failed:Load model from /onnx_models//yolov3/yolov3.onnx failed:[ShapeInferenceError] Number of elements of input 'scales' must be same as rank of input 'X' and element type must be float. System information
OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Ubuntu 16.04 ONNX Runtime installed from (source or binary): source ONNX Runtime version: github Python version: 3.5 Visual Studio version (if applicable): NA GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source): gcc 7.4.0 CUDA/cuDNN version:NA GPU model and memory: NA
To Reproduce Describe steps/code to reproduce the behavior: Download the YOLO V3 model from ONNX model zoo. Run the following command: ~/onnxruntime/build/Linux/RelWithDebInfo# ./onnxruntime_perf_test -e cpu -m times -r 1 Expected behavior A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. It should run with out errors on OnnxRunTime default CPU. Screenshots If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Additional context Add any other context about the problem here. complete log after executing the command: /onnx_models/yolov3/yolov3.onnx ./results.txt Setting thread pool size to 0 Load model from /onnx_models/yolov3/yolov3.onnx failed:[ShapeInferenceError] Number of elements of input 'scales' must be same as rank of input 'X' and element type must be float.

comments.comment: Hi, This should have been fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/commit/c96049fe4ad16f1964257e442fad6906e0acb198>c96049f</denchmark-link> . Di d you include this commit in your build ? CC: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/raymondxyang>@raymondxyang</denchmark-link>
Yes the changes were merged last afternoon.. would u mind kindly confirm you are using the latest version of onnxruntime?

Thanks, this worked. We can close the issue now.

Yes the changes were merged last afternoon.. would u mind kindly confirm you are using the latest version of onnxruntime?
